document_title: Genital warts: Causes, signs, complications, prevention
subsection_content:
If you are sexually active, you can take the following measures to protect yourself and your partner from the risk of getting or spreading HPV and other sexually transmitted diseases: (4)
Use condoms when having sex; Check periodically according to your doctor's instructions; Thorough treatment of sexually transmitted diseases; Talk to your partner if you are infected with HPV to get treatment together; Be monogamous or limit the number of sexual partners; Get the HPV vaccine to proactively protect your health. The vaccine can protect you from genital warts and also from HPV strains linked to cancer risk. This vaccine is given in 1-3 doses, depending on age, and should be given before sexual intercourse, as it is most effective when a person has not been exposed to HPV.

Call hotline 0287 102 6789 (HCMC) or 024 3872 3872 (Hanoi) to register for a private medical appointment with a specialist, through customer service staff.; Register for a medical appointment with any doctor you trust at the link: https://tamanhhospital.vn/danh-cho-khach-hang/dat-lich-kham/; Send a message on Tam Anh General Hospital Fanpage or Tam Anh General Hospital Urology and Andrology Fanpage; Text message via Zalo OA of Tam Anh General Hospital.
Genital warts are one of the common sexually transmitted diseases. Some people only get it once, while others have frequent relapses. Treatment can remove the wart, but it cannot completely remove the HPV virus. Therefore, you should prevent the risk of infection and pay attention to safe and faithful sex.
